Description: Fragment of carnelian ring and four and a half beads made of faience. A: Fragment of a ring, probably a finger ring, made of carnelian. A groove parallel to the body divides the piece into two raised compartments that are half circular in section. The outer surface is well polished and smoothed. Traces of the drill are visible in the inner face. B: One and a half cylindrical segmented beads made of white faience, the longer one is broken in half and was preserved in a length of 9 segments. C: One extended spherical bead made of white faience. D: Two disc-shaped beads, one made of ostrich eggshell, the other made of white faience.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
